Body: I used to run Siri Proxy on my Mac mini, and it allowed me to build custom commands that Siri would respond to while I was on the same network.  "Turn on the living room lights"  "Run the sprinklers"  "Dim the lights for a movie" Now that I've moved to Android, I'd like to be able to achieve this same goal. Can anyone direct me to a solution whereby I can use some Voice App in combination with a local proxy to achieve this desired result?
Title: Voice App with custom proxy ability

history.Text: I used to run [Siri Proxy][1] on my Mac mini, and it allowed me to build custom commands that Siri would respond to while I was on the same network.> "Turn on the living room lights"  > "Run the sprinklers"  > "Dim the lights for a movie" Now that I've moved to Android, I'm hoping that I can find a similar app/proxy combination. Since Android is so much more open over iOS, I have a hunch that there is something better out there, I just don't know where to start looking.  [1]: https://github.com/plamoni/SiriProxy
